articles.headline: At Home in the World
articles.snippet: G.E. is using strong overseas sales to reshape its image in Europe, where hard feelings still linger from its aborted effort to acquire Honeywell in 2001.
articles.abstract: G.E. is using strong overseas sales to reshape its image in Europe, where hard feelings still linger from its aborted effort to acquire Honeywell in 2001.
articles.lead_paragraph: As soon as Jeffrey R. Immelt, General Electric’s chairman, became chief executive in 2001, his foreign-based managers began pressing him to move some major operations overseas.

articles.headline: Bomb in Syria Kills Militant Sought as Terrorist
articles.snippet: Imad Mugniyah, one of America’s most wanted men, was accused of bombings, hijackings and kidnappings.
articles.abstract: Imad Mugniyah, one of America’s most wanted men, was accused of bombings, hijackings and kidnappings.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon  A top Hezbollah commander long sought by the United States for his role in terrorist attacks that killed hundreds of Americans in the 1980s, died Tuesday night in Damascus, Syria, when a bomb detonated under the vehicle he was in, Syrian officials said.
articles.byline: By Robert F. Worth and Nada Bakri

articles.headline: Michelle Obama Thrives in Campaign Trenches
articles.snippet: Outspoken, strong-willed, funny and sometimes sarcastic, Michelle Obama is playing a pivotal role in her husband’s campaign.
articles.abstract: Outspoken, strong-willed, funny and sometimes sarcastic, Michelle Obama is playing a pivotal role in her husband’s campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  There is no confusing Michelle Obama for her husband on the campaign trail.

articles.headline: Little Room for Yahoo to Maneuver
articles.snippet: Many Yahoo shareholders are waiting for a higher bid than that offered by Microsoft, but analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.
articles.abstract: Many Yahoo shareholders are waiting for a higher bid than that offered by Microsoft, but analysts say it is increasingly unlikely.
articles.lead_paragraph: Can Yahoo avoid being gobbled up by Microsoft?
articles.byline: By Miguel Helft and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Obama’s Lead in Delegates Shifts Focus of Campaign
articles.snippet: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s advisers made it clear that they were prepared to take potentially incendiary steps to build her delegate count.
articles.abstract: Hillary Rodham Clinton’s advisers made it clear that they were prepared to take potentially incendiary steps to build her delegate count.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  Senator Barack Obama emerged from Tuesday’s primaries leading Senator Hillary Rodham Clinton by more than 100 delegates, a small but significant advantage that Democrats said would be difficult for Mrs. Clinton to make up in the remaining contests in the presidential nomination battle.

articles.headline: So, What Were We Writing About Again?
articles.snippet: One returning Hollywood writer asked, “Can anyone remember what we were working on three months ago?”
articles.abstract: One returning Hollywood writer asked, “Can anyone remember what we were working on three months ago?”
articles.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES  Facing his writing staff on Wednesday for the first time since the end of a 100-day strike, Shane Brennan, the co-executive producer of the CBS drama “NCIS,” asked a question that drew blank stares. “Can anyone remember what we were working on three months ago?”

articles.headline: Ending Impasse, Iraq Parliament Backs Measures
articles.snippet: The three laws are the budget, a law outlining the scope of provincial powers and an amnesty for detainees.
articles.abstract: The three laws are the budget, a law outlining the scope of provincial powers and an amnesty for detainees.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD  Iraq’s parliamentary leaders on Wednesday pushed through three far-reaching measures that had been delayed for weeks by bitter political maneuvering that became so acrimonious that some lawmakers threatened to try to dissolve the legislative body.

articles.headline: A Little Piece of Microsoft Aids Small Business
articles.snippet: Office Live Small Business gives the nation’s 25 million small businesses the same online tools that the big boys use, and it shows Microsoft can still produce fresh ideas and polished work.
articles.abstract: Office Live Small Business gives the nation’s 25 million small businesses the same online tools that the big boys use, and it shows Microsoft can still produce fresh ideas and polished work.
articles.lead_paragraph: So Microsoft is making a hostile bid for Yahoo.

articles.headline: Inquiry Set on Health Care Billing
articles.snippet: New York’s attorney general is looking into whether insurers overcharged patients for out-of-network doctors.
articles.abstract: New York’s attorney general is looking into whether insurers overcharged patients for out-of-network doctors.
articles.lead_paragraph: It is a common medical puzzler. The benefits statement arrives from the insurance company, saying that although the doctor has charged, say, $200 for that recent office visit, only $80 is covered  and the consumer is obliged to pick up the balance.
